revised_title: Magnetic Spectroscopy of X-ray Electrons: New Results and Findings
tldr: The authors conducted magnetic spectroscopy experiments on X-ray electrons and found that the heat of activation for the reaction between aldehyde and iodine molecules is 32,500 calories. They discovered two types of photoelectrons, primary and secondary cathode ray groups, which have different energy sources and behaviors. This research helps improve the understanding of atomic physics and the behavior of X-ray electrons.
